title: Lesson 64
paragraph: This lesson focuses on performance and drama, including theatrical, expressive, and interpretive skills.

words.meaning: relating to acting or drama; exaggerated or dramatic
words.example: His theatrical gestures amused the audience.
The film’s emotive scenes brought tears to many eyes.

words.japaneseMeaning: 表現力のある、感情を表す
words.example: Her expressive face revealed her inner thoughts.

words.meaning: related to or constituting an action or performance
words.japaneseMeaning: パフォーマンス的な、演技的な
words.example: The poet’s reading was highly performative.

words.meaning: exciting or impressive; relating to drama
words.example: The play had a dramatic climax.

words.meaning: bringing strong images, memories, or feelings to mind
words.japaneseMeaning: 喚起する、思い起こさせる
words.example: The painting is evocative of childhood memories.

words.meaning: possessing an appealing charm or influence
words.japaneseMeaning: カリスマ的な、人を引きつける
words.example: The charismatic leader inspired the crowd.
He wore a flamboyant costume to the party.

words.meaning: performed or occurring as a result of impulse rather than planning
words.example: Their spontaneous applause surprised the performers.

words.meaning: relating to or providing an interpretation
words.example: The dancer gave an interpretive performance of the poem.
